summary: Nyingma is the name of one of the four major schools of Tibetan Buddhism.
full_text:
The Nyingma tradition is the oldest of the four major schools of Tibetan Buddhism . "Nyingma" literally means "ancient," and is often referred to as Ngangyur  because it is founded on the first translations of Buddhist scriptures from Sanskrit into Old Tibetan in the eighth century. The Tibetan alphabet and grammar was actually created for this endeavour.
In modern times, the Nyingma lineage has been centered in Kham.
title: Nyingma
